docblock.description: PHPMailer - PHP email creation and transport class NOTE: Requires PHP version 5 or later

tag.name: license
tag.description: http://www.gnu.org/copyleft/lesser.html GNU Lesser General Public License

file.class:
PHPMailer \PHPMailer PHP email creation and transport class STOP_MESSAGE STOP_MESSAGE 0 STOP_CONTINUE STOP_CONTINUE 1 STOP_CRITICAL STOP_CRITICAL 2 CRLF CRLF "\r\n" $Priority 3 Email priority (1 = High, 3 = Normal, 5 = low). int $CharSet 'iso-8859-1' Sets the CharSet of the message. string $ContentType 'text/plain' Sets the Content-type of the message. string $Encoding '8bit' Sets the Encoding of the message.

Options for this are "8bit", "7bit", "binary", "base64", and "quoted-printable".

string $ErrorInfo '' Holds the most recent mailer error message. string $From 'root@localhost' Sets the From email address for the message. string $FromName 'Root User' Sets the From name of the message. string $Sender '' Sets the Sender email (Return-Path) of the message.

If not empty, will be sent via -f to sendmail or as 'MAIL FROM' in smtp mode.

string $ReturnPath '' Sets the Return-Path of the message.

If empty, it will be set to either From or Sender.

string $Subject '' Sets the Subject of the message. string $Body '' Sets the Body of the message.

This can be either an HTML or text body. If HTML then run IsHTML(true).

string $AltBody '' Sets the text-only body of the message.

This automatically sets the email to multipart/alternative. This body can be read by mail clients that do not have HTML email capability such as mutt. Clients that can read HTML will view the normal Body.

string $MIMEBody '' Stores the complete compiled MIME message body. string $MIMEHeader '' Stores the complete compiled MIME message headers. string $mailHeader '' Stores the extra header list which CreateHeader() doesn't fold in string $WordWrap 0 Sets word wrapping on the body of the message to a given number of characters. int $Mailer 'mail' Method to send mail: ("mail", "sendmail", or "smtp"). string $Sendmail '/usr/sbin/sendmail' Sets the path of the sendmail program. string $UseSendmailOptions true Determine if mail() uses a fully sendmail compatible MTA that supports sendmail's "-oi -f" options boolean $PluginDir '' Path to PHPMailer plugins.

Useful if the SMTP class is in a different directory than the PHP include path.

string $ConfirmReadingTo '' Sets the email address that a reading confirmation will be sent. string $Hostname '' Sets the hostname to use in Message-Id and Received headers and as default HELO string.

If empty, the value returned by SERVER_NAME is used or 'localhost.localdomain'.

string $MessageID '' Sets the message ID to be used in the Message-Id header.

If empty, a unique id will be generated.

string $MessageDate '' Sets the message Date to be used in the Date header.

If empty, the current date will be added.

string $Host 'localhost' Sets the SMTP hosts.

All hosts must be separated by a semicolon. You can also specify a different port for each host by using this format: [hostname:port] (e.g. "smtp1.example.com:25;smtp2.example.com"). Hosts will be tried in order.

string $Port 25 Sets the default SMTP server port. int $Helo '' Sets the SMTP HELO of the message (Default is $Hostname). string $SMTPSecure '' Sets connection prefix.

Options are "", "ssl" or "tls"

string $SMTPAuth false Sets SMTP authentication.

Utilizes the Username and Password variables.

bool $Username '' Sets SMTP username. string $Password '' Sets SMTP password. string $AuthType '' Sets SMTP auth type.

Options are LOGIN | PLAIN | NTLM (default LOGIN)

string $Realm '' Sets SMTP realm.

@var string

$Workstation '' Sets SMTP workstation.

@var string

$Timeout 10 Sets the SMTP server timeout in seconds.

This function will not work with the win32 version.

int $SMTPDebug false Sets SMTP class debugging on or off. bool $Debugoutput "echo" Sets the function/method to use for debugging output.

Right now we only honor "echo" or "error_log"

string $SMTPKeepAlive false Prevents the SMTP connection from being closed after each mail sending.

If this is set to true then to close the connection requires an explicit call to SmtpClose().

bool $SingleTo false Provides the ability to have the TO field process individual emails, instead of sending to entire TO addresses bool $SingleToArray array() If SingleTo is true, this provides the array to hold the email addresses bool $LE "\n" Provides the ability to change the generic line ending NOTE: The default remains '\n'.

We force CRLF where we KNOW it must be used via self::CRLF

string $DKIM_selector '' Used with DKIM Signing required parameter if DKIM is enabled

domain selector example domainkey

string $DKIM_identity '' Used with DKIM Signing required if DKIM is enabled, in format of email address 'you@yourdomain.com' typically used as the source of the email string $DKIM_passphrase '' Used with DKIM Signing optional parameter if your private key requires a passphras string $DKIM_domain '' Used with DKIM Singing required if DKIM is enabled, in format of email address 'domain.com' string $DKIM_private '' Used with DKIM Signing required if DKIM is enabled, path to private key file string $action_function '' Callback Action function name.

The function that handles the result of the send email action. It is called out by Send() for each email sent.

Value can be: - 'function_name' for function names - 'Class::Method' for static method calls - array($object, 'Method') for calling methods on $object See http://php.net/is_callable manual page for more details.

Parameters: bool $result result of the send action string $to email address of the recipient string $cc cc email addresses string $bcc bcc email addresses string $subject the subject string $body the email body string $from email address of sender

string $Version '5.2.4' Sets the PHPMailer Version number string $XMailer '' What to use in the X-Mailer header string $smtp null \SMTP $to array() array $cc array() array $bcc array() array $ReplyTo array() array $all_recipients array() array $attachment array() array $CustomHeader array() array $message_type '' string $boundary array() array $language array() array $error_count 0 integer $sign_cert_file '' string $sign_key_file '' string $sign_key_pass '' string $exceptions false boolean mail_passthru mail_passthru Calls actual mail() function, but in a safe_mode aware fashion Also, unless sendmail_path points to sendmail (or something that claims to be sendmail), don't pass params (not a perfect fix, but it will do) string string string string string bool $to $subject $body $header $params edebug edebug Outputs debugging info via user-defined method string $str __construct __construct Constructor boolean $exceptions false IsHTML IsHTML Sets message type to HTML. bool void $ishtml true IsSMTP IsSMTP Sets Mailer to send message using SMTP. void IsMail IsMail Sets Mailer to send message using PHP mail() function. void IsSendmail IsSendmail Sets Mailer to send message using the $Sendmail program. void IsQmail IsQmail Sets Mailer to send message using the qmail MTA. void AddAddress AddAddress Adds a "To" address. string string boolean $address $name '' AddCC AddCC Adds a "Cc" address.

Note: this function works with the SMTP mailer on win32, not with the "mail" mailer.

string string boolean $address $name '' AddBCC AddBCC Adds a "Bcc" address.

Note: this function works with the SMTP mailer on win32, not with the "mail" mailer.

string string boolean $address $name '' AddReplyTo AddReplyTo Adds a "Reply-to" address. string string boolean $address $name '' AddAnAddress AddAnAddress Adds an address to one of the recipient arrays Addresses that have been added already return false, but do not throw exceptions string string string \phpmailerException boolean $kind $address $name '' SetFrom SetFrom Set the From and FromName properties string string int \phpmailerException boolean $address $name '' $auto 1 ValidateAddress ValidateAddress Check that a string looks roughly like an email address should Static so it can be used without instantiation, public so people can overload Conforms to RFC5322: Uses *correct* regex on which FILTER_VALIDATE_EMAIL is based; So why not use FILTER_VALIDATE_EMAIL? Because it was broken to not allow a@b type valid addresses :( Some Versions of PHP break on the regex though, likely due to PCRE, so use the older validation method for those users.

(http://php.net/manual/en/pcre.installation.php)

string boolean $address Send Send Creates message and assigns Mailer.

If the message is not sent successfully then it returns false. Use the ErrorInfo variable to view description of the error.

\phpmailerException bool PreSend PreSend Prep mail by constructing all message entities \phpmailerException bool PostSend PostSend Actual Email transport function Send the email via the selected mechanism \phpmailerException bool SendmailSend SendmailSend Sends mail using the $Sendmail program. string string \phpmailerException bool $header $body MailSend MailSend Sends mail using the PHP mail() function. string string \phpmailerException bool $header $body SmtpSend SmtpSend Sends mail via SMTP using PhpSMTP Returns false if there is a bad MAIL FROM, RCPT, or DATA input. string string \phpmailerException bool $header $body SmtpConnect SmtpConnect Initiates a connection to an SMTP server.

Returns false if the operation failed.

\phpmailerException bool SmtpClose SmtpClose Closes the active SMTP session if one exists. void SetLanguage SetLanguage Sets the language for all class error messages.

Returns false if it cannot load the language file. The default language is English.

string string bool $langcode 'en' $lang_path 'language/' GetTranslations GetTranslations Return the current array of language strings array AddrAppend AddrAppend Creates recipient headers. string array string $type $addr AddrFormat AddrFormat Formats an address correctly. string string $addr WrapText WrapText Wraps message for use with mailers that do not automatically perform wrapping and for quoted-printable.

Original written by philippe.

string integer boolean string $message $length $qp_mode false UTF8CharBoundary UTF8CharBoundary Finds last character boundary prior to maxLength in a utf-8 quoted (printable) encoded string.

Original written by Colin Brown.

string int int $encodedText $maxLength SetWordWrap SetWordWrap Set the body wrapping. void CreateHeader CreateHeader Assembles message header. string GetMailMIME GetMailMIME Returns the message MIME. string GetSentMIMEMessage GetSentMIMEMessage Returns the MIME message (headers and body).

Only really valid post PreSend().

string CreateBody CreateBody Assembles the message body.

Returns an empty string on failure.

\phpmailerException string GetBoundary GetBoundary Returns the start of a message boundary. string string string string string $boundary $charSet $contentType $encoding EndBoundary EndBoundary Returns the end of a message boundary. string string $boundary SetMessageType SetMessageType Sets the message type. void HeaderLine HeaderLine Returns a formatted header line. string string string $name $value TextLine TextLine Returns a formatted mail line. string string $value AddAttachment AddAttachment Adds an attachment from a path on the filesystem.

Returns false if the file could not be found or accessed.

string string string string \phpmailerException bool $path $name '' $encoding 'base64' $type 'application/octet-stream' GetAttachments GetAttachments Return the current array of attachments array AttachAll AttachAll Attaches all fs, string, and binary attachments to the message.

Returns an empty string on failure.

string string string $disposition_type $boundary EncodeFile EncodeFile Encodes attachment in requested format.

Returns an empty string on failure.

string string \phpmailerException string $path $encoding 'base64' EncodeString EncodeString Encodes string to requested format.

Returns an empty string on failure.

string string string $str $encoding 'base64' EncodeHeader EncodeHeader Encode a header string to best (shortest) of Q, B, quoted or none. string string string $str $position 'text' HasMultiBytes HasMultiBytes Checks if a string contains multibyte characters. string bool $str
